title: Address Bar default search
content: I do not like to use the ADDRESS BAR for search and navigation. I prefer to use the GOOGLE SEARCH field. I am visually impaired, and cannot easily read the tiny font in the search bar, whereas I can ZOOM / expand the GOOGLE SEARCH field. PLEASE stop forcing users to jump to the ADDRESS BAR when they type into the GOOGLE SEARCH field. OR you will “force” me to jump away from FIREFOX. Alternately, provide a means to EXPAND THE FONT in the ADDRESS BAR.
creator: jetgraphics

title: NO FUNIONA FIREFOX TAMPOCO
content: FIREFOX, TAMPOCFUNCIONA, ME GUSTA ABRIR LASPAGINAS UE VISITO, UNA POR VENTANA,PERO,ALCERRAR, SECIERRAN,TRES DE CUANTRO, DEJANDO LAULTIMA SIN CERRAR, POR LO CUAL AL CERRARLA, AL DIA SIGUIENTE,HAY QUE ABRIR LAS SIGUIENTES, NUEVAMENTE, LOS RPOBLEMAS DENGHTLY QUE NO CARGABA NINGUNA PAGINA, SIGUEN SUCEDIENDO
creator: daniel.herrero2014

title: clear site preferences for zoom settings?
content: I'm trying to increase my default zoom. The problem is most of the sites I use most often are remaining at 100% zoom, and therefore their font size is not changing when I change the default in my settings. Another site I'm often on is set to 85% zoom for ?? reasons?? and stays stuck there no matter what I do. I thought these were problems with the Fixed Zoom extension, but I've disabled that extension and the problems haven't gone away. (And the problem I got that extension to fix in the first place, in which dw-news dot dreamwidth dot org and dw-beta dot dreamwidth dot org and every single user or community on dreamwidth dot org are all apparently different sites and I want to be able to set the correct zoom for all of Dreamwidth *once*, is of course back.) How do I clear out the site-by-site zoom settings so everything goes back to default zoom?
creator: alexconall

title: Font Not Displayed Correctly After Cleaning Junk Files
content:
Hi,

I just installed Clean My Mac, and clean junk files. After that, I open my Firefox, and found a problem with Facebook Business Manager font.

The font displayed on that site is not normal.

1. I've checked my other Firefox on other device, they are run normal. 2. And when I turn troubleshoot mode to on, the font was normal too. 3. My other Firefox profile on other device run normal.

I have uninstall Firefox and delete leftover file, and then reinstall it again. But same condition.

Maybe there are issue with Firefox or my device (because I delete the junk files that may be needed by Firefox)

so, what should I do?

Additional Info: - MacBook Air - MacOS BigSur 11.4


Thank you
creator: imamherlambang

title: Sound in Firefox Browser
content:
Recently, I began having sound problems with Firefox -- doesn't matter what I am watching: a stream, a youtube video, anything.....suddenly the video will stop as if buffering (I see the three dots)...video will then resume, but without sound.

I have run diagnostics on my computer sound and everything is fine....I've even troubleshooted while affected video is soundless....I get sound through my sound devices....yet nothing through firefox. The only solution is close the brower and return to target site....however, that is only temporary as the loss of volume will occur again within 5-10 minutes.

The other solution (which lasts a little longer) is to uninstall and reinstall the browser. I have tested other browsers and this does not happen. I am at a loss.
creator: scoker813

title: Trojan found by Malwarebytes
content: I have been using Firefox forever but in the last few days I get a notification from Malwarebytes that they blocked a Trojan malware named "boxclone.com". It appears constantly when I use Firefox. I switched to Chrome and it stopped showing. I'd like to make Firefox my default browser again but I want to know what to do about this pop-up from MB. Thank you
creator: benmarh

title: Updates disabled by"my organization" how to enable?
content: How can I access line 5046 where update is disabled. How to change value. I have Firefox 80. I may have to abandon the Mozilla browser on this my only desktop.
creator: GaryG70

title: **My** Firefox profile is blocking GitHub.com!
content:
Hello.

Firefox prevents me from opening the following URL, citing Google Safe Browsing advisory:

https://github.com/sandboxie-plus/Sandboxie/releases

Google, however, denies having issued any recommendation to block.

I have noticed that the problem has something to do with my own profile. The problem doesn't appear under the following circumstances:

  • I start Firefox in troubleshooting mode
  • I start Firefox with a new profile

I tried manually disabling all my add-ons, but even with all of them disabled, I can still reproduce the problem.

Any idea what could be wrong with my setup?
creator: FleetCommand
